titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Mifford, Indictment
CWG1488

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p:
Scott Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
William Mifford

The Grand Jury of Scott County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse William Mefford of the
Crime of Horse Stealing
committed as follows viz: The said William Mefford on the 20th day of November 1862 in the county aforesaid, Feloniously took and carried away one Sorrel Horse and one Bay Horse The property of William Hinton.

Witnesses
Dr Bresden
Buford Hall
Will Emerson
James Acre
Dr John (Kenton Co)

I Jno W. Holloway clerk of the Scott Circuit Court do certify that the foregoing eighteen lines contain a full and complete transcript of the Indictment found by the Grand Jury of Scott County at the November Term of the Court 1862 against William Mefford for Horse Stealing. In Testimony whereof I have hereto written my name this 3rd day of January 1863
fee 40cts

Jno W. Holloway c s c c
By Geo E. West D. C.

Scott.
Cir. Ct.
Comth of Kentucky
vs} Indictment Horse Stealing
William Mefford
A copy
att Geo E. West D C
Requisition on Indiana
Issd. Jan. 12th 1863
Scott
fee 40cts
Geo. W. Toner
Agent
